database_manager module

Database Management Module

This module provides database functionality for the school management system using SQLite. It handles all database operations including CRUD operations, search functionality, backup/restore capabilities, and data synchronization with the core system objects.

class database_manager.DatabaseManager(db_path: str = 'school_management.db')[source]

Bases: object

Database manager class for the school management system.

Provides comprehensive database operations for managing students, instructors, courses, and their relationships using SQLite. Includes features like automatic timestamping, data integrity constraints, and backup functionality.

Parameters:

db_path (str, optional) – Path to the SQLite database file, defaults to “school_management.db”

Variables:

db_path (str) – Path to the database file

add_course(course: Course) → bool[source]

Add a new course to the database.

Inserts a course record with optional instructor assignment. Validates foreign key relationships and handles constraint violations.

Parameters:

course (Course) – The course object to add to the database

Returns:

True if course was added successfully, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

add_instructor(instructor: Instructor) → bool[source]

Add a new instructor to the database.

Inserts an instructor record with all validation constraints applied. Handles duplicate instructor ID and email address errors gracefully.

Parameters:

instructor (Instructor) – The instructor object to add to the database

Returns:

True if instructor was added successfully, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

bool

backup_database(backup_path: str = None) → bool[source]

Create a backup copy of the database file.

Creates a timestamped backup copy of the database file for data recovery purposes.

Parameters:

backup_path (str, optional) – Path for the backup file, defaults to auto-generated timestamped name

Returns:

True if backup was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

delete_course(course_id: str) → bool[source]

Delete a course from the database.

Removes the course record and all associated student registrations due to CASCADE constraints.

Parameters:

course_id (str) – The ID of the course to delete

Returns:

True if deletion was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

delete_instructor(instructor_id: str) → bool[source]

Delete an instructor from the database.

Removes the instructor record and sets instructor_id to NULL in associated courses due to SET NULL constraint.

Parameters:

instructor_id (str) – The ID of the instructor to delete

Returns:

True if deletion was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

delete_student(student_id: str) → bool[source]

Delete a student from the database.

Removes the student record and all associated course registrations due to CASCADE constraints.

Parameters:

student_id (str) – The ID of the student to delete

Returns:

True if deletion was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

export_to_csv(table_name: str, output_path: str) → bool[source]

Export database table to CSV format.

Exports the specified table or view to a CSV file with proper headers. Supports exporting students, instructors, courses, and registrations.

Parameters:

  • table_name (str) – Name of the table to export (‘students’, ‘instructors’, ‘courses’, ‘registrations’)

  • output_path (str) – Path to the output CSV file

Returns:

True if export was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

init_database()[source]

Initialize the database with all required tables and triggers.

Creates the complete database schema including: - Students table with validation constraints - Instructors table with validation constraints - Courses table with foreign key relationships - Student-course registration junction table - Automatic timestamp update triggers

All tables include created_at and updated_at timestamp fields.

load_system_from_db() → SchoolManagementSystem[source]

Load all data from database into a SchoolManagementSystem object.

Reconstructs the complete object hierarchy with all relationships between students, instructors, and courses properly established.

Returns:

A fully populated SchoolManagementSystem object

Return type:

SchoolManagementSystem

register_student_to_course(student_id: str, course_id: str) → bool[source]

Register a student for a course in the database.

Creates a registration record linking a student to a course. Prevents duplicate registrations and validates foreign key relationships.

Parameters:

  • student_id (str) – The ID of the student to register

  • course_id (str) – The ID of the course to register for

Returns:

True if registration was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

search_courses(search_term: str) → List[Tuple][source]

Search for courses by name or ID.

Performs case-insensitive partial matching and includes instructor information.

Parameters:

search_term (str) – The term to search for

Returns:

List of tuples containing (course_id, course_name, instructor_id, instructor_name)

Return type:

List[Tuple]

Search for instructors by name, ID, or email.

search_term (str) – The term to search for

Returns:

List of tuples containing (instructor_id, name, age, email)

Return type:

List[Tuple]

sync_system_to_db(system: SchoolManagementSystem) → bool[source]

Synchronize a SchoolManagementSystem object to the database.

Completely replaces all database contents with the data from the provided system object. This operation is destructive and irreversible.

Parameters:

system (SchoolManagementSystem) – The system object to synchronize to the database

Returns:

True if synchronization was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

unregister_student_from_course(student_id: str, course_id: str) → bool[source]

Unregister a student from a specific course.

Removes the registration record linking the student to the course.

Parameters:

  • student_id (str) – The ID of the student to unregister

  • course_id (str) – The ID of the course to unregister from

Returns:

True if unregistration was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

update_course(course_id: str, course_name: str = None, instructor_id: str = None) → bool[source]

Update course information in the database.

Updates only the specified fields, leaving others unchanged. Automatically updates the updated_at timestamp.

Parameters:

  • course_id (str) – The ID of the course to update

  • course_name (str, optional) – New name for the course, defaults to None

  • instructor_id (str, optional) – New instructor ID for the course, defaults to None

Returns:

True if update was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

update_instructor(instructor_id: str, name: str = None, age: int = None, email: str = None) → bool[source]

Update instructor information in the database.

Updates only the specified fields, leaving others unchanged. Automatically updates the updated_at timestamp.

Parameters:

  • instructor_id (str) – The ID of the instructor to update

  • name (str, optional) – New name for the instructor, defaults to None

  • age (int, optional) – New age for the instructor, defaults to None

  • email (str, optional) – New email for the instructor, defaults to None

Returns:

True if update was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

update_student(student_id: str, name: str = None, age: int = None, email: str = None) → bool[source]

Update student information in the database.

Updates only the specified fields, leaving others unchanged. Automatically updates the updated_at timestamp.

Parameters:

  • student_id (str) – The ID of the student to update

  • name (str, optional) – New name for the student, defaults to None

  • age (int, optional) – New age for the student, defaults to None

  • email (str, optional) – New email for the student, defaults to None

Returns:

True if update was successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool
